title: Bound Print, "Altro spaccato per longo della stessa bottega, ove si vedonofra le aperture del vestibolo le immense piramide, from Diverse Maniere d'adornare i cammini", 1769
signed: Signed in plate, lower left: Disegno ed invenzione del Cavalier Piranesi; lower right: Cav.r Piranesi F.
inscribed: Inscribed in plate, lower margin: Altro spaccato per longo della stessa bottega, ove si vedonofra le aperture del vestibolo le immense piramide, ed altri / edifizj sepolerali ne' deserti dell' Ogitto.; lower right: 45
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Gustave Gilbert
description: A compartmentalized scene with several Egyptian figures and caryatids. Upper register depicts a cow in profile, along with birds, a crocodile, a cat, and a hawk. The central register depicts three areas, two of which show figures before a landscape with pyramids and other structures. At the center, two figures hold stelae inscribed with hieroglyphs, with another stela in the center. The lower register contains smaller depictions of figures, some winged, sphinxes, snakes, and other Egyptian characters.

tombstone.epitaph:
Bound Print, "Altro spaccato per longo della stessa bottega, ove si vedonofra le aperture del vestibolo le immense piramide, from Diverse Maniere d'adornare i cammini", 1769.
1769. Etching on paper. Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Gustave Gilbert. 1967-85-24-52.
